resources.string: Here, in addition to the role "Administrator", you can authorize additional roles for access to the "Preferences" module.
The module can be completely deactivated using this setting. (Default: Deactivated)
The account details of the recipient are to be entered.
Check for completeness of the account data.
For the listed members, the profile field for the account holder (=payer) is not empty and address details are missing for this payer.
Here you have the option of directly editing the entries "Contribution", "Contribution period" and "Description" in all contribution roles (except for family roles).

Here, the age limits have to be entered up to which the family members will be checked. When a senior role (e.g. as from 60 years of age) exists, it may be more favourable to split up a family and to settle the membership fee for each member separately.
Checking of age-based roles for discrepancies with regard to the age stipulations.
The listed roles show some gaps and / or overlapping.
The remapping is canceled because gaps or overlaps exist in the age-based roles.
There are no loopholes or overlapping in the age-based roles.

Either a basic amount or a consumption amount can be specified here. If a consumption amount is specified, an associated profile field must also be selected. From a mathematical point of view, the value of "Basic or Consumption Amount" is multiplied by the value of the selected profile field. If no profile field is specified, it is multiplied by 1.
The creation of the SEPA XML file / control file was aborted. Account #VAR1_BOLD# requires a BIC because it is not an EU / EEA account.

Checks for the presence of a BIC. Payments outside the EU / EEA continue to require a BIC (Currently the following countries: Switzerland, Monaco, San Marino, Jersey, Guernsey, Isle of Man, St. Pierre and Miquelon).
The listed members or the account details of the association are missing the BIC.
Creates a file (.XLSX or .CSV) with data to generate invoices and offers the possibility to send bank transfer requests via email.

The text for a transfer request by e-mail can be adjusted and supplemented here. Texts have two paragraphs (subject & content) which are identified by titles like #subject# and #content#. Content parts follow after this titles.\n\nThe following placeholders can be used in each e-mail, which are then replaced by the corresponding content at runtime.
Pick the category to which a member must belong basically to be considered when examining the role membership. With no choice, this option is meaningless.
They are refilled after the plugin Delete and then restart with default values.
Configuration data is the data that are set via the "Preferences" menu.

With this, an analysis of the contribution data can be displayed, differentiated between contribution that are stored in a member's profile and contributions that are defined in the contribution roles.
With this contributions, contributions text, paid-date and duedate can be deleted.
Here a history of the contributions can be displayed. The basis is a set payment date and the entries of the contribution, the contribution text and the due date.
Here, a minimum calculated amount can be entered. Calculated membership fees that are lower than this amount are filtered out and not written into the database.
Via this option, a "payment received" date can be written into the database.
The membership fee text can be preceded by a prefix.
If the pro rata contribution calculation is to be determined based on a role assignment, the checkmark must be ticked (if the checkbox is deactivated, the admission date is used).

If the date of joining is selected, the pro rata calculation is always made from the date of joining to the end of the year.

If role membership is selected, the beginning and end of membership in a role are evaluated.

In the case of family roles, the data of the payer (joining date, start / end of role membership) is always used to calculate the pro rata contribution.
The respective checkbox has to be activated if all fees are to be rounded off for the benefit of the member.
Proportional membership fees can be followed by a suffix.
The respective checkbox has to be activated if the names of all family members are to appear in the membership fee text.
The respective checkbox has to be activated if the user name is to appear in the membership fee text.
Separator used to mark the user name / names of the family members in the membership fee text Separators marked with (*) are not permissible in EU bank transfers.

File names are to be entered without suffix.

Example:
Control file name: "Kontroll-Datei" becomes "Kontroll-Datei-2013-04-01-RCUR.csv"
This profile data of a member can be copied to another Member.

First pick from a source and then a destination copying. Then you determine about "choice" which profile field of "source" to "target" is copied. The copying process is done automatically by setting the hook of the target range.

By default, membership references are generated for members,
 - if they do not have one yet
 - and for which an IBAN is deposited.

 Using this role selection, generation can only be carried out for the selected roles. If no restriction is to be made to specific roles, this field should be left blank.
No new mandate references can be assigned because all affected members or all affected members of the selected roles already have a mandate reference.
The new mandate references have only been calculated but not yet saved.
The new mandate references have been saved.
created with the plugin membership fee of the online member management Admidio
Delete only data of the current organization.
- When you delete the data, an error has occurred..\n
- The created data has been cleared.\n
\nTo completely remove the plugin the program files and the menu entry must be removed.
No data has been selected for deletion.
- The table "adm_plugin_preferences" could not be deleted because it houses more data from other plugins.\n
About the uninstall generated by the plugin entries can be deleted from the database.
*** This routine deletes only the entries in the Admidio database. Program files and the link in the menu will not be deleted! ***
'Delete all' deletes all contributions (including contributions text and paid-date).
Delete IBAN, BIC and bank name
The profile fields in this category are visible for several organizations and will be deleted regardless of the setting in "organizational choice".
The following options are only available during the SEPA introduction phase.
Here, the separator used to extract the ages in the age-based roles is to be entered.
\n --> In this case, the membership fee of members aged between 14 and 18 is calculated.
Enter a name for this configuration of an individual contribution.
DTA Export exports data currently contained in the database. If new members exist and no recalculation (reassignment) has been performed yet, the database may not be up-to-date.
Herewith all displayed users (! filter-dependent !), the due date is changed. -> a non-existent date is set -> an existing date is removed
The chosen here due date is entered when a user is setting a hook.
Via this option, a due date can be defined or deleted.

By default, all contribution roles are considered while editing the due date. About this role selection editing the due date may be performed only for the selected roles. There should be no restriction on certain roles, so this field should be left blank.
Choose the roles for which the due date to be processed. Selection of more than one role is possible by pressing the Ctrl button.
Select one or more combinations of due date and sequence type to create the XML or control file.
There are no data selected for an e-mail delivery.

Here you can justify the text of each email notification. The texts are divided into two parts (subject and content) and are identified by #subject# and #content#. The content for each section follows it.\n\nIn each mail the following wildcards can be used. They will be replaced with the corresponding content at runtime
It was elected with another bank new bank account, but the IBAN is the same. - That can not be.
ERROR: At least one configuration must be present!
In the fields nothing has changed.
The IBAN has been changed at the same bank. The original IBAN field must therefore be filled.
The mandate reference was changed. The original mandate reference field must be filled.
The events selected here can then be assigned a contribution and a contribution period using the "Advanced role editing" module.

By default, no contribution and no contribution period can be assigned for an event in Admidio. A contribution of 0 and a contribution period of "One time" is assigned to the selected dates via the "Appointment selection". As a result, they are recognized by the plugin as contribution roles and can be edited further.
There is no data to be exported.
The contribution for family roles with this prefix.
The contribution period for family roles with this prefix.
The description for family roles with this prefix.
Here, the prefix for family roles is to be entered. This value identifies all family roles.
Review of family roles to the specified number of members in the setup.

Here for each family role a check condition in the format from*to:number be spezified. Several conditions are to be separated by a semicolon.\nExample: 14*17:0;18*59:2 means: Examination to 0 members aged 14 to 17 years and testing for 2 members aged 18 to 59 years.
In the listed families at least one member does not meet the test conditions.
All families follow the test conditions.
Here the entries of contribution, contribution period and description of family roles can be compared with the information in the settings and updated.
An update is not necessary, as the entries of contribution, contribution period and description of all family roles match the settings in the setup.
The family roles to be updated have only been identified so far. No data has been saved yet.
Do you want to create the missing fields and categories?
Gaps in membership numbers are filled.

You can specify a formatting used to create a member number here.

A formatting can contain up to three segments: the pre-segment, the sequential number, the secondary segment, the example: ENG####GYMN. Each change in the pre-segment causes a new start of the sequence number. The sequence number is marked with the character #. The subsequent segment is only attached to the member number generated by the pre-segment and serial number.

DEU###GYMN generates, for example, the following member numbers: DEU001GYMN, DEU002GYMN, DEU999GYMN, DEU1023GYMN. AUT###GYMN generates, for example, the following member numbers: AUT001GYMN, AUT002GYMN, AUT999GYMN, AUT1023GYMN.
Check for correct IBAN (Note: The IBAN check digit at the third and fourth digits of the IBAN is checked on the basis standard IBAN rule.).
For the members listed, the IBAN is wrong.
The Individual contributions module can be used to calculate individual contributions, such as electricity or water consumption.
The new posts and post texts
No new individual contributions could be calculated.
The new individual contributions have only been calculated so far, but not yet saved.
The new individual contributions have been saved.
The setup routine for the membership fee has detected that a version update has been performed and therefore checks the structure.
terminates this setup routine (If changes to the database have been made, it is highly recommended to restart Admidio).
Checking of profile fields (desired / actual value comparison)
Checking for missing profile fields and categories.
E-mail has been sent successfully to:

Entries have to be made here if mandate data has changed since the last collection. No new mandate is required. Only the original values have to be included into the XML data record. Prior to a new collection, the original data entered here has to be deleted manually.

Entries have to be made here if mandate data has changed since the last collection. No new mandate is required. Only the original values have to be included into the XML data record. The original data entered here is automatically deleted upon setting a "payment received" date.
Herewith, a change of mandate of the payee and/or Creditor Identifier can be performed.
With this option, mandate data can be edited.
Via the fields described above, the parameters for compiling the mandate reference can be configured.
Checking of completeness of data for mandate management purposes.
The listed members have IBAN and membership fee, but either mandate reference or mandate date (or both) are missing.
Herewith all displayed users (! filter-dependent !), the mandate date is changed. -> a non-existent date is set -> an existing date is removed
The selected date is entered here mandate for a user when setting a hook.
An already set mandate date can only be changed via "Edit profile".
*** WARNING *** This data can not be recovered after deletion !!! *** DANGER ***
User data is the data that are set in a user's profile (e.g. IBAN or due date).
Program has been aborted due to duplicate membership number #VAR1_BOLD#.
No new member numbers can be assigned because all members, or all members of the selected roles, already have a member number.
The new membership numbers have only been calculated, but have not yet been saved.
The basis of this data are the account details and the Membership Fee and Paid entries of the members liable to pay.
The authorization check of the plugin failed. There is more than one menu item with the same URL defined.\n\n=> #VAR1_BOLD#
Here, the minimum number of family members is to be entered. A family should have at least two members as the single contribution for a member is certainly less than a family contribution.
Mandate reference move to original mandate reference
Multiplier roles are family roles where the contribution value is not added but serves as a multiplier. The value is a percentage (e.g. 70 corresponds to 70%).
File names are to be given without the file extension.
A corresponding new age role is missing or the member is already a member of this age role.
Does not perform any modification to the database. But the plugin cannot be started.
There are no contribution roles available!\n\nDefine at least one role a 'contribution' and a 'contribution period'.

No account details could be converted

 as either all members already have an IBAN / BIC / bank name
 or insufficient information (bank code, account number) is available.
There are no due date.\n\nThe download of the XML file and control file is only possible if at least one due date has been set.
After each addition or deletion of a configuration the Save button has to be pressed.

With a monthly offset, the reference time a) for the classification into the age-based roles and b) for the age-related tests can be shifted by x months in the future or in the past (0 corresponds to no offset).

The reference time is always December 31st. (24 hours) of the past year.

Example of the division into an age-based role:
A role should be given with the following age restrictions:
"Members %1% to %2% years"
In this case, it is checked whether the member on 31.12. (midnight) of the past year still fit into the age structure "1 to 2" years (minimum was 1 year old, or maximum was 2 years and 365 days old). If not, it will be moved to another role.

With a monthly offset, this reference point in time can be shifted by full months in the future or in the past.
Should be deleted in all the organizations selected in sections 2 and 3 data, or only in the current?
This date is entered by a user as an identifier for a contribution payment made.\n\nAn existing date is not overwritten.

By default, all contribution roles are considered while editing the contributions. About this role selection editing the contributions may be performed only for the selected roles. There should be no restriction on certain roles, so this field should be left blank.

#subject# Membership fee transfer request
#content# Dear member,

we would like to remind you that on April 1st the annual membership fee of #fee# Euro is due.

Please transfer the contribution to our account within the next 14 days.

Kind regards
#organization_long_name#

#subject# Payment reminder
#content# Dear Member,

we would like to remind you that on 1 April, the membership fee was due.

Please transfer the amount within the next 14 days.

Sincerely yours
#organization_long_name#

#subject# Debit subscription
#content# Dear Member,

on #due_day# we book a membership fee of #fee# euros 
with the mandate reference number #mandate_id# 
and our creditors-ID #creditor_id# 
from your account #iban#.

Please ensure sufficient funds.

Sincerely yours
#organization_long_name#
Creates a file (.XLSX or .CSV) with data to create serial letters for pre-notifications and enables sending of pre-notifications by e-mail.

Please individualize the e-mail message here. Texts have two paragraphs (subject & content) which are identified by titles like #subject# and #content#. Content parts follow after this titles.\n\nEach message can have free space for current messages.
Generates membership numbers for active members in the current organization.

By default, membership numbers are created for all active members of the current organization. About this role selection a generation may be performed only for the selected roles. If you do not want to restrict certain roles, leave this field blank.
If a consumption amount is specified, a profile field (with the specification of the consumption) must be selected here.

Settings for the calculation mode. The following options are available:
- Standard: An actual contribution (except for 0 â‚¬) is not changed.
- Overwrite: Existing entries are deleted and replaced by new entries.
- Add up: Contributions are summed and contribute text is supplemented.
If on the role selection the calculation limited to certain roles, so also the calculation mode affects only for those roles. Existing posts which are not covered by these roles remain unchanged.
The new contributions and contribution texts
No new contributions could be calculated.
If the recalculation is only to be carried out for members who have not yet paid (for which there is no paid date), then check the box.
The new contributions have only been calculated but not yet saved.

By default, all contribution roles are considered at a recalculation. About this role selection a recalculation may be performed only for the selected roles. There should be no restriction on certain roles, so this field should be left blank.
Due to entries in the role selection, only the following role(s) was considered for the contribution calculation:
The new contributions have been saved.
Via this option, all members of age-based roles are reassigned.
>For the member #VAR1# #VAR2# no date of birth has been entered.
A remapping is not required because all members are in the proper age-based role.
The new role affiliations have only been calculated but not yet saved.
The new role affiliations have been saved.
Summary of the reallocation performed on #VAR1#
Removes all membership fees from the database.
Removes all membership fee texts from the database.
Removes all "payment received" markings from the database.
Here a role must be selected for which this individual contribution is calculated.
Checking for multiple memberships in age-based roles.
Select the graduations that should not be included in the exam.
Here it is checked whether a member belongs to several age-based roles. By default, all age-based roles are considered. With this option, one or more graduations can be removed from consideration.
The members are listed multiple times in different echelons of the age-based roles.
No member is repeatedly in different echelons of the age-based roles.
To which membership roles must a member belong at least (inclusive-OR operation)?\nAll possible roles are to be marked.
The listed members are not in any mandatory membership role (or no mandatory membership roles have been defined).
All members are in at least one mandatory membership role.
Checking for duplicate memberships in excluded roles
Which role memberships are to exclude each other?
The listed members exist twice in at least two excluded membership roles.
No member exists twice in any excluded membership role.
Here is an overview of all contribution roles.
Currently, the following roles are authorised.

The basis of this data are the entries in the setup, not the entries for the individual roles in the database. Manually changed membership fees for individual roles or proportional membership fees are not taken into account. For this reason, this can only be regarded as a forecast.
The displayed data is for information purposes only. No changes will be made to the database. Should there be any differences (DESIRED / ACTUAL), the plugin may not function correctly.

The plugin membership fee generates a single SEPA XML file based on the selected parameters. However, the file may not be accepted by the bank / home banking program if it has multiple due dates. It is therefore recommended to create an XML file with only one due date.\n\n FRST=first debit, RCUR=recurring debit, FNAL=final debit, OOFF=one-off debit
There is not enough data to export.
Sequence type: empty=first debit(FRST) R=recurring debit(RCUR) F=final debit(FNAL) O=one-off debit(OOFF)
The value set here sequence type is set at the same time setting a due date.
Enter a short name here. After the contribution calculation has been carried out, this short name appears in the contribution text.
This selected here Member is the source of the copy action.
This selected here Member is the target of the copy action.
The following tests can be activated individually. Additional settings may be possible for some tests. All settings made here are only for checking, they do not affect the calculation.
This profile fields can not be copied because they have different data types (for example, date to text).
Mandate reference for this collection of contributions

Here you can define the columns for the views contribution payments, mandate management, due dates and invoices.\n\n Note: One or more columns are already predefined in the respective views. These can not be moved in their position and can not be deleted.
'With paid-date' deletes only the contributions (including contributions text and paid-date) where a paid-date is available.
'Without paid-date' deletes only the contributions (including contributions text and paid-date) for which no paid-date is available.
Incorrect individual configuration\n\nWrong information is available in at least one configuration.
File names are to be entered without suffix.\n\nExample:\XML file name: "SEPA-Datei" becomes "SEPA-Datei-2013-04-01-RCUR.xml"
The new member numbers have been saved.
